Bel, the Baal of the Babylonians
Nebo, the name of a Babylonian deity, also of a mountain in Moab, and of a place in Palestine
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
to load, i.e. impose aburden (or figuratively, infliction)
a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

exiled; captured; as noun, exile (abstractly or concretely and collectively); by extension, booty
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

near, with or among; often in general, to
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

5.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to compare; by implication, to resemble, liken, consider
properly, to level, i.e. equalize; figuratively, to resemble; by implication, to adjust (i.e. counterbalance, be suitable, compose, place, yield, etc.)
to liken, i.e. (transitively) to use figurative language (an allegory, adage, song or the like); intransitively, to resemble
to compare; by implication, to resemble, liken, consider

gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
a cup; also a bag formoney or weights
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
a reed (as erect); by resemblance a rod (especially for measuring), shaft, tube, stem, the radius (of the arm), beam (of a steelyard)
to suspend or poise (especially in trade)
to fuse (metal), i.e. refine (literally or figuratively)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the shoulder (proper, i.e. upper end of the arm; as being the spot where the garments hang); figuratively, side-piece or lateral projection of anything

to deposit; by implication, to allow to stay

to be a man, i.e. act in amanly way

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

first, in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun)

strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so

the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity

who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
